basics.name: Matt Bachmann
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I am a passionate developer with ties to the Python community. I solve problems with technology and continously strive to improve my craft. I love working with product, customers, and fellow developers to take an idea and turn it into an implementation. I want to join an organization where I can make a lasting impact and engage with the wider development community.

work.summary: Developed compliance and DLP applications on Google's App Engine and Amazons AWS cloud platforms.
highlights: Built an internal service that scans millions of items per day for PCI, PII, Login Credentials and other information companies want to track in their various cloud environments
Integrated with cloud APIs to analyze data from several cloud platforms

work.summary: Developed and maintained a web application to assist restaurant managers in cutting costs by managing labor and inventory.
highlights: Implemented several reports pages and ported legacy Perl code to modern Java
Assisted in transitioning from a Ant based build to a Maven build

work.summary: Developed software to assist teachers in educating and assessing middle school students in cellular biology.
highlights: Trained machine learned models to track and assess student behavior
Published and spoke at academic conferences discussing and demonstrating the value of advanced analytics when assessing student behavior.

publications.name: Tracking Students’ Inquiry Paths through Student Transition Analysis
publications.publisher: The Third International Conference on Educational Data Mining

publications.name: Do Differences in Student’s Exploration Behavior lead to differences in  Domain Learning or Inquiry Skills?
WTF? Detecting Students who are  Conducting Inquiry Without Thinking Fastidiously
publications.publisher: The 20th conference on User Modeling, Adaptation, and Personalization
